title: Apply Even-Odd Identities
text: Recall the following properties: cotangent is odd, cosine is even, and sine is odd.

title: Rewrite Each Term
text: Apply the identities to each part of the expression: $$cot\left(-x\right) cos\left(-x\right)+\operatorname{sinnegneg}\left(x\right)=\left(-\operatorname{cot}\left(x\right)\right) cos\left(x\right)+\left(-sin\left(x\right)\right)=-cot(x)cos(x)-sin(x)$$

title: Express cotx in Terms of sinx and cosx
text: Recall that $$cot(x)=\frac{cosx}{sinx}$$. Substitute this in: $$=\frac{cosx}{sinx} cos\left(x\right)-sin\left(x\right)$$ $$=\frac{-\left({cos}^2 x+{sin}^2 x\right)}sin^$\left(x\righ$$ $$=\frac{-1}sin^$\left(x\righ$$ $$=-csx(x)$$
